botanical_details.genus: Solanum can be annuals, perennials, evergreen or deciduous shrubs or twining climbers, with simple or pinnnately lobed leaves and star- or bowl-shaped, 5-lobed flowers with prominent stamens, followed by fleshy fruits

how_to_grow.cultivation: Plant out in April with 35cm between tubers. Select an open site with deep, fertile, moisture-retentive soil. Draw earth up around the stems as the emerge, to exclude light and prevent the potatoes from becoming green. See Potato cultivation for further information
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate from seed potatoes which have been chitted prior to planting
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to cutworms, slugs, wireworms, and potato cyst eelworm
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to potato blight, potato blackleg, potato scabs and potato tuber rots
